intro: Calystegia macrostegia subsp. tenuifolia, commonly known as slender leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. The subspecies is distinguished by its slender, elongated leaves and shorter, more compact stems compared to the typical form. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks. This plant is not only ornamental but also serves as a food source for various insect species.
